stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Cash Advance Laws in Florida
stateCompliance.content:
Residents of Deerfield Beach are protected by Florida's comprehensive payday lending regulations, administered by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation's Division of Consumer Finance.

Florida law caps single-payment payday loans at $500 with a maximum fee of 10% of the loan amount, plus a $5 verification fee. For a $500 loan, you would pay no more than $55 in fees. For installment payday loans, the maximum is $1,000 with fees capped at 8% of the outstanding balance on a biweekly basis. All lenders must comply with federal Truth-in-Lending Act disclosure requirements.

One of Florida's most important protections is the 'one loan at a time' rule. You cannot have more than one payday loan outstanding anywhere in Florida, and you must wait 24 hours after paying off one loan before taking out another. This is enforced through a mandatory statewide database. Loan rollovers and extensions are strictly prohibited.
keyPoints: All payday lenders in Florida must be licensed by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation
You can only have one cash advance loan at a time in Florida
Single-payment loans are capped at $500 with maximum 10% fee plus $5 verification fee
Installment loans are capped at $1,000 with maximum 8% biweekly fee
You must wait 24 hours after paying off one loan before taking out another
Loan rollovers and extensions are prohibited by law
If you can't pay on time, you're entitled to a 60-day grace period with free credit counseling
You cannot be criminally prosecuted for an unpaid payday loan
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: Florida Office of Financial Regulation (OFR), Division of Consumer Finance
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal or financial advice. Payday loan laws and regulations are subject to change. This information was last verified on January 15, 2025. For the most accurate information about Florida payday loan regulations, please contact the Florida Office of Financial Regulation.

faq.question: Where is your Deerfield Beach cash advance office?
faq.answer: We're located at 1850 Federal Highway, Suite 105, just a short walk from the famous Deerfield Pier and Deerfield Beach. We're easy to find from I-95, US-1, and FL-A1A. Free parking is available for our customers.

faq.question: What are your operating hours in Deerfield Beach?
faq.answer: Monday through Friday 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Saturday 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM. We're closed on Sundays. For holiday hours, call (954) 555-0134.

faq.question: How long does the approval process take in Deerfield Beach?
faq.answer: Most customers are approved and receive funding within 30 minutes. You can apply online and visit our office to speed up the process. We make getting emergency cash fast and easy.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to get a cash advance?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government-issued ID (driver's license or passport), recent proof of income (pay stub or bank statement), and a blank check from your checking account. We'll explain all costs upfront before you sign anything.

faq.question: Are there other cash advance locations near Deerfield Beach?
faq.answer: Yes! We serve Broward County including Pompano Beach (6 miles), Coral Springs (8 miles), Margate (4 miles), and Lighthouse Point (5 miles). Call us for directions to your nearest location.
